result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:58 AM - cases called - 21CF332 and 22CF62.  Defendant Kevion Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Cana G Kohn in court for Kevion Williams.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of these matters.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Sgt. Investigator Kevin Orzech duly sworn and testifies in 22CF62.  Direct by Atty Polzin.  Defendant identified by Sgt. Investigator Orzech.  Cross by Atty Orzech.  No redirect.  No argument.  Court finds probable cause in 22CF62 and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  In receipt - plea of not guilty to all counts.  Court accepts not guilty plea to all counts.  Bond will continue.
Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Andrew R Polzin appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Sgt. Investigator Kevin Orzech appeared in court.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of these matters.  Court questions Atty Kohn.  Response by Atty Kohn - can appear specially in 22CF62.  Court will proceed with these matters.  Sgt. Response by Atty Kohn - requesting an arraignment.  Bond will continue in 21CF332.  Statement by Atty Kohn - in receipt of complaint in 22CF62 - waive reading.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court sets bond.  Defendant to appear via Zoom at the next hearing.
